ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely the Hell is an ambush,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Hell will lie in wait (for its prey).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed hell is lying in ambush.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Truly, Hell is a place of ambush
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Behold, Gehenna has become an ambush,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the Hell is an ambuscade:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Truly, Hell is a place of ambush,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, Gehenna (Hell) has become an ambush,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [78:21] Verily Hell lurks in ambush (mirsādan, in the sense of rāsidatan or mursidatan, ‘lying in wait’)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Lo! Hell lurketh in ambush) the Fire is a detention and prison,
